SHORT NAME: Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation (the)
LIST NAME: Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation
FULL NAME: the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation
NOTES:
In case of publications or documents with multiple references to this territory, the first reference should read “the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation (hereinafter referred to as “Crimea”)”. Subsequent references can be the short term “Crimea”.

For titles, headings, websites, posters and other contents where space is limited, accepted alternatives include: (a) “the temporarily occupied Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine”, (b) “the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine”, or (c) “eastern Ukraine” when the intention is specifically to refer to that geographical area.

On FAO maps, the term “Autonomous Republic of Crimea” should be used (please refer to the UN country map of Ukraine at: https://www.un.org/geospatial/content/ukraine). All maps must show the Autonomous Republic of Crimea within the territory of Ukraine.
ENGLISH_LIST NAME: Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation
